definition: to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: All four subjects go back to the tradition of Pythagoras .
sentences.chinese: 所有四门科目可追溯到毕达哥拉斯时代的传统。

sentences.english: One of Pythagoras ' beliefs was that the essence of being is number.
sentences.chinese: 毕达哥拉斯一个信念是“存在的本质是数”。

sentences.english: Pythagoras is my friend in these days.
sentences.chinese: 毕达哥拉斯是我的朋友在这些日子。
在毕达哥拉斯定理中还有更复杂的例子。

sentences.english: He is best known for the Pythagorean theorem, which bears his name.
sentences.chinese: 他因以自己名字命名的毕达哥拉斯定理而最为知名。

sentences.english: It is considered to be part of the widespread legends of Pythagoras of this time.
sentences.chinese: 这被认为是部分普遍传说毕达哥拉斯的这个时候。

sentences.english: Of or relating to Pythagoras or his geometry.
sentences.chinese: 属于或关于毕达哥拉斯或他的几何学的。

sentences.english: The Greek scientist, Pythagoras , used it as a remedy for scorpion stings.
sentences.chinese: 希腊科学家毕达哥拉斯把芥菜当作治疗蝎子螫伤的药。

sentences.english: Zhuang-zi the time which locates with Pythagoras is similar.
sentences.chinese: 庄子同毕达哥拉斯所处的时代差不多。

definition: Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Euclid of Alexandria (c. 300 BC), Greek geometer and author of Elements 幾何原本|几何原本
Leibniz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
Euclid of Alexandria (c. 300 BC), Greek geometer and author Elements 幾何原本|几何原本
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
neo-Platonism (philosophical system combining Platonism with mysticism)
pinyin: xin1 Bo2 la1 tu2 zhu3 yi4
